intro: Hoya mindorensis, commonly known as the Mindanao Wax Plant, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of star-shaped, waxy flowers. The plant produces fragrant, white to pale pink blooms that typically appear in summer. Hoya mindorensis is a compact shrub that thrives in bright, indirect light and well-draining soil. It is relatively low-maintenance, making it a popular choice for indoor gardening.
